<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can now see why this shape had so many pieces: small piece of land floating off in the Atlantic Ocean!</p>
<p>Now that we have a cursory understanding of how to create these maps, let's stop focusing on Maine and consider the entire USA. We can generate some maps for each of the different <code>properties</code> such as <code>tvperc</code> and <code>cableperc</code>, using almost the same code as above:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[49]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Generate a map for TV ownership by Neilson market</span>
ggalbers<span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_polygon<span class="p">(</span>data <span class="o">=</span> dma_geo_df<span class="p">,</span> 
                 color <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"gray80"</span><span class="p">,</span>
                 aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> long<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> lat<span class="p">,</span> group <span class="o">=</span> group<span class="p">,</span> fill <span class="o">=</span> tvperc<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Neilson DMAs - Percent TV"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    guides<span class="p">(</span>fill <span class="o">=</span> guide_legend<span class="p">(</span>title <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Percentage\nTV Ownership"</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[52]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Generate a map for cable subscriptions by Neilson market</span>
ggalbers<span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    geom_polygon<span class="p">(</span>data <span class="o">=</span> dma_geo_df<span class="p">,</span> 
                 color <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"gray80"</span><span class="p">,</span>
                 aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> long<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> lat<span class="p">,</span> group <span class="o">=</span> group<span class="p">,</span> fill <span class="o">=</span> cableperc<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Neilson DMAs - Percent Cable"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    guides<span class="p">(</span>fill <span class="o">=</span> guide_legend<span class="p">(</span>title <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Percentage\nCable Subs"</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

AF4oMWBheENbuleCt/Oy1hYAXirEEN5QBfZL8HZe1toCwMslJrylHtopwRt6UasLAC+ZiPAm

gO/eA8DIPiIH8/C7/wAwsods6sCqVQeAkekDvbMFgJGpA74zBoARpOIAMIJUHABGkIoDwAhS
cQAYQSoOACNIxQFgBKk4AIwgFQeAEaTiADCCVBwARpCKA8AIUnEAGEEqDgAjSMUBYASpOACM
IBUHgBGk4gAwglQcAEaQigPACFJxABhBKg4AI0jFAWAEqTgAjCAVB4ARpOIAMIJUHABGkIoD

YASpOACMIBUHgBGk4gAwglQcAEaQigPACFJxABhBKg4AI0jFAWAEqTgAjCAVB4ARpOIAMIJU

MIJUHABGkIoDwAhScQAYQSoOACNIxQFgBKk4/x+yujXRk5sH1AAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==" />
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Second-Order-of-Business">Second Order of Business<a class="anchor-link" href="#Second-Order-of-Business"></a></h4><p>Now that we have a good idea of what the data looks like, what are we going to do with it? Well, we want to answer similar questions to those we answered in <strong>Sinclair Station Exploration</strong>. Namely:</p>
<ol>
<li>How has the number of markets Sincliar operates inside of changed over time?</li>
<li>How does the spread of these markets look like spatially, from the viewpoint of the US as a whole?</li>
</ol>
<p>To do this, we'll need to combine <code>dma_geo_df</code> and <code>sinclair_station_all_df</code> by matching each station in <code>sinclair_station_all_df</code> to their designated market in <code>dma_geo_df</code>. Once we do this we'll know which markets Sinclair operates in and when they started that operation.</p>
<p>How can we do this? If you scroll up you'll see that <code>sinclair_station_all_df</code> conveniently has a <code>Market</code> column; this should be the obvious method for matching stations with their markets.</p>
<p>Unfortunately, we won't be able to use this. If you look at the market names in both dataset for a single state (say Illinois), you'll find something like this:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Show markets in `sinclair_station_all_df` for Illinois</span>
IL_mask <span class="o"><-</span> str_sub<span class="p">(</span>sinclair_station_all_df<span class="o">$</span>Market<span class="p">,</span> start <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">-2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s">"IL"</span>
<span class="kp">unique</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_station_all_df<span class="p">[</span>IL_mask<span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Market"</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>Champaign - Urbana - Decatur - Springfield, IL</li>
<li>Peoria & Bloomington, IL</li>
<li>Cape Girardeau, MO - Paducah, KY - Harrisburg, IL</li>
<li>Hannibal, MO - Quincy, IL</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Show markets in `dma_geo_df` for Illinois</span>
IL_mask <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">sapply</span><span class="p">(</span>dma_geo_df<span class="o">$</span>dma1<span class="p">,</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">)</span> <span class="kp">grepl</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"IL"</span><span class="p">,</span> x<span class="p">))</span>
<span class="kp">unique</span><span class="p">(</span>dma_geo_df<span class="p">[</span>IL_mask<span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"dma1"</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>Chicago, IL</li>
<li>Rockford, IL</li>
<li>Paducah, KY-Cape Girardeau, MO-Harrisburg, IL</li>
<li>Champaign & Springfield-Decatur, IL</li>
<li>Peoria-Bloomington, IL</li>
<li>Davenport, IA-Rock Island-Moline, IL</li>
<li>Quincy, IL-Hannibal, MO-Keokuk, IA</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The example above suggests that market names between the two datasets do not seem to match well. Above, we would need to match:</p>
<table>
<thead><tr>
<th>Sinclair Station Market Name</th>
<th>Nielsen DMA Market Name</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><code>Champaign - Urbana - Decatur - Springfield, IL</code></td>
<td><code>Champaign & Springfield-Decatur, IL</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><code>Peoria & Bloomington, IL</code></td>
<td><code>Peoria-Bloomington, IL</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><code>Cape Girardeau, MO - Paducah, KY - Harrisburg, IL</code></td>
<td><code>Paducah, KY-Cape Girardeau, MO-Harrisburg, IL</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><code>Hannibal, MO - Quincy, IL</code></td>
<td><code>Quincy, IL-Hannibal, MO-Keokuk, IA</code></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>While we <em>can</em> probably figure this out using a bit of regex engineering, we'll take a different approach in this notebook. To match a Sinclair owned station with its market, we'll look at the location (<code>Latitude</code>, <code>Longitude</code>) of the station and determine if it's geographically inside of a given market. This method, while initially more difficult, is a lot less error prone than trying to match strings.</p>
<h4 id="Merge-the-Datasets">Merge the Datasets<a class="anchor-link" href="#Merge-the-Datasets"></a></h4><p>Remember just a little while ago when I said that we won't need to worry about <code>dma_geo_sh</code> because we converted it to a regular data frame called <code>dma_geo_df</code>? I may have lied.</p>
<p>There's a function in the spatial library <code>sp</code> called <code>over</code> (short for "overlay") that takes in two spatial objects (like <code>dma_geo_sh</code>) and tells us whether one is inside of another one. This is exactly what we need to find out which stations are inside of which markets!</p>
<p>It works like this: if we have a list of coordinates called <code>A</code> and a list of polygons called <code>B</code> then the code <code>A %over% B</code> would result in a list that has the same length as <code>A</code> and is composed of objects from <code>B</code> that enclose each coordinate in <code>A</code>.</p>
<p>I think a more concrete example is in order. Lets take a few rows from <code>sinclair_station_all_df</code>:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[65]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Get 5 rows from `sinclair_station_all_df`</span>
test_df <span class="o"><-</span> na.omit<span class="p">(</span>sinclair_station_all_df<span class="p">)</span>
test_samples <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">sample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="kp">nrow</span><span class="p">(</span>test_df<span class="p">),</span> <span class="m">5</span><span class="p">)</span>

test_df<span class="p">[</span>test_samples<span class="p">,]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th></th><th scope="col">Market</th><th scope="col">Station</th><th scope="col">Channel.RF.</th><th scope="col">Year</th><th scope="col">Power.kW</th><th scope="col">Location</th><th scope="col">Latitude</th><th scope="col">Longitude</th><th scope="col">Year.Start</th><th scope="col">Year.End</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr><th scope="row">203</th><td>Springfield - Holyoke, MA        </td><td>WGGB-TV                          </td><td>40 (40)                          </td><td>1998-2007                        </td><td> 460                             </td><td>42.241667; -72.649167            </td><td>42.24167                         </td><td> -72.64917                       </td><td>1998                             </td><td>2007                             </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">207</th><td>Kansas City, Missouri            </td><td>KSMO-TV                          </td><td>62 (47)                          </td><td>1996-2005                        </td><td>1000                             </td><td>39.090500; -94.472000            </td><td>39.09050                         </td><td> -94.47200                       </td><td>1996                             </td><td>2005                             </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">208</th><td>Plattsburgh, NY - Burlington, VT </td><td>WPTZ                             </td><td>5 (14)                           </td><td>1997-1998                        </td><td> 650                             </td><td>44.52556; -72.81556              </td><td>44.52556                         </td><td> -72.81556                       </td><td>1997                             </td><td>1998                             </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">194</th><td>Colorado Springs - Pueblo, CO    </td><td>KXRM-TV                          </td><td>21 (22)                          </td><td>2013-2014                        </td><td>  51                             </td><td>38.745389; -104.860889           </td><td>38.74539                         </td><td>-104.86089                       </td><td>2013                             </td><td>2014                             </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">197</th><td>Tallahassee, FL - Thomasville, GA</td><td>WTXL-TV                          </td><td>27 (27)                          </td><td>2001-2006                        </td><td>1000                             </td><td>30.66833; -83.96944              </td><td>30.66833                         </td><td> -83.96944                       </td><td>2001                             </td><td>2006                             </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Next, convert the locationo of each station into a <code>SpatialPoints</code> object, which is just a list of <code>Longitude</code>, <code>Latitude</code> pairs:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[66]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Convert the data frame to a `SpatialPoints` object</span>
test_sh <span class="o"><-</span> SpatialPoints<span class="p">(</span>test_df<span class="p">[</span>test_samples<span class="p">,</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Longitude"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Latitude"</span><span class="p">)])</span>

<span class="c1"># Make sure that the projection from `test_sh` is the same as in `dma_geo_sh`</span>
proj4string<span class="p">(</span>test_sh<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><-</span> proj4string<span class="p">(</span>dma_geo_sh<span class="p">)</span>

test_sh
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre>SpatialPoints:
     Longitude Latitude
203  -72.64917 42.24167
207  -94.47200 39.09050
208  -72.81556 44.52556
194 -104.86089 38.74539
197  -83.96944 30.66833
Coordinate Reference System (CRS) arguments: +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84
+no_defs +ellps=WGS84 +towgs84=0,0,0 </pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Finally, use the <code>over()</code> function see which DMAs belong to which station:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[67]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>results_df <span class="o"><-</span> test_sh <span class="o">%over%</span> dma_geo_sh
results_df
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th></th><th scope="col">name</th><th scope="col">latitude</th><th scope="col">tvperc</th><th scope="col">dma</th><th scope="col">dma1</th><th scope="col">cableperc</th><th scope="col">adsperc</th><th scope="col">longitude</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr><th scope="row">203</th><td>dma:                           </td><td>42.38569                       </td><td>94.8                           </td><td>543                            </td><td>Springfield-Holyoke, MA        </td><td>81.5                           </td><td>14.0                           </td><td> -72.60171                     </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">207</th><td>dma:                           </td><td>39.30423                       </td><td>87.2                           </td><td>616                            </td><td>Kansas City, MO                </td><td>62.7                           </td><td>24.7                           </td><td> -94.20899                     </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">208</th><td>dma:                           </td><td>44.07130                       </td><td>90.8                           </td><td>523                            </td><td>Burlington, VT-Plattsburgh, NY </td><td>52.5                           </td><td>38.7                           </td><td> -73.03687                     </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">194</th><td>dma:                           </td><td>38.06138                       </td><td>86.5                           </td><td>752                            </td><td>Colorado Springs-Pueblo, CO    </td><td>43.6                           </td><td>43.5                           </td><td>-104.02717                     </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">197</th><td>dma:                           </td><td>30.46230                       </td><td>93.0                           </td><td>530                            </td><td>Tallahassee, FL-Thomasville, GA</td><td>55.1                           </td><td>38.6                           </td><td> -83.67571                     </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Hey, it works! The column <code>dma1</code> (the DMA names) from <code>results_df</code> matches the <code>Market</code> column from <code>test_df</code>. And best of all, we didn't need to loop through every DMA polygon and check whether the station we're currently looking at is inside; all of that was done for us.</p>
<p>Now, we can define a function that will repeat the work above:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[71]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># A function that looks through `geo_sh` (list of polygons) for the first polygon that</span>
<span class="c1"># contains the coordinates in `lon` and `lat`. Once found, it extracts the wanted attribute.</span>
attribute_of_locations <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>geo_sh<span class="p">,</span> lon<span class="p">,</span> lat<span class="p">,</span> attribute<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Turn `lon`, `lat` into a `SpatialPoints` object</span>
    points_sh <span class="o"><-</span> SpatialPoints<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">cbind</span><span class="p">(</span>lon<span class="p">,</span> lat<span class="p">))</span>
    proj4string<span class="p">(</span>points_sh<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><-</span> proj4string<span class="p">(</span>geo_sh<span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Overlay `points_sh` on top of `geo_sh`</span>
    results_df <span class="o"><-</span> points_sh <span class="o">%over%</span> geo_sh
    
    results_df<span class="p">[,</span>attribute<span class="p">]</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The <code>attribute_of_locations()</code> function takes a list of coordinates (in the form of two separate vectors <code>lon</code> and <code>lat</code>), and for each coordinate, it finds the polygon inside of <code>geo_sh</code> that contains the coordinate. After finding the polygon, i it extracts the wanted attribute from that polygon.</p>
<p>Onto the long awaited moment! We will use <code>attrubute_of_locations()</code> to merge our Sinclair station data and our Nielsen DMA data. The functions <code>filter()</code> and <code>mutate()</code> will be useful:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[75]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>sinclair_station_dma_df <span class="o"><-</span> sinclair_station_all_df <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    select<span class="p">(</span><span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Market"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Station"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Latitude"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Longitude"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Year.Start"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Year.End"</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">%>%</span>
    filter<span class="p">(</span><span class="o">!</span><span class="kp">is.na</span><span class="p">(</span>Latitude<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="o">!</span><span class="kp">is.na</span><span class="p">(</span>Longitude<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">%>%</span>
    mutate<span class="p">(</span>DMA <span class="o">=</span> attribute_of_locations<span class="p">(</span>dma_geo_sh<span class="p">,</span> Longitude<span class="p">,</span> Latitude<span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"dma1"</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">%>%</span>
    mutate<span class="p">(</span>DMA.Code <span class="o">=</span> attribute_of_locations<span class="p">(</span>dma_geo_sh<span class="p">,</span> Longitude<span class="p">,</span> Latitude<span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"dma"</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[76]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_station_dma_df<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th scope="col">Market</th><th scope="col">Station</th><th scope="col">Latitude</th><th scope="col">Longitude</th><th scope="col">Year.Start</th><th scope="col">Year.End</th><th scope="col">DMA</th><th scope="col">DMA.Code</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr><td>Birmingham - Tuscaloosa - Anniston, AL     </td><td>WTTO                                       </td><td>33.48458                                   </td><td>-86.80708                                  </td><td>1995                                       </td><td>NA                                         </td><td>Birmingham (Anniston and Tuscaloosa), AL   </td><td>630                                        </td></tr>
<tr><td>Birmingham - Tuscaloosa - Anniston, AL     </td><td>WABM                                       </td><td>33.48458                                   </td><td>-86.80706                                  </td><td>2001                                       </td><td>NA                                         </td><td>Birmingham (Anniston and Tuscaloosa), AL   </td><td>630                                        </td></tr>
<tr><td>Birmingham - Tuscaloosa - Anniston, AL     </td><td>WBMA-LD                                    </td><td>33.48458                                   </td><td>-86.80706                                  </td><td>2014                                       </td><td>NA                                         </td><td>Birmingham (Anniston and Tuscaloosa), AL   </td><td>630                                        </td></tr>
<tr><td><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">Mobile, AL & Pensacola, FL            </span></td><td>WEAR-TV                                                                           </td><td>30.61261                                                                          </td><td>-87.64489                                                                         </td><td>1997                                                                              </td><td>NA                                                                                </td><td>Mobile, AL-Pensacola (Ft. Walton Beach), FL                                       </td><td>686                                                                               </td></tr>
<tr><td><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">Mobile, AL & Pensacola, FL            </span></td><td>WPMI-TV                                                                           </td><td>30.61139                                                                          </td><td>-87.60733                                                                         </td><td>2012                                                                              </td><td>NA                                                                                </td><td>Mobile, AL-Pensacola (Ft. Walton Beach), FL                                       </td><td>686                                                                               </td></tr>
<tr><td><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">Mobile, AL & Pensacola, FL            </span></td><td><span style="white-space:pre-wrap">WFGX   </span> </td><td>30.61261                                                                          </td><td>-87.64489                                                                         </td><td>2001                                                                              </td><td>NA                                                                                </td><td>Mobile, AL-Pensacola (Ft. Walton Beach), FL                                       </td><td>686                                                                               </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now we have an association from each Sinclair TV station to one particular DMA. This is all we need to start answering our questions.</p>
<h3 id="Graphs-and-Analysis">Graphs and Analysis<a class="anchor-link" href="#Graphs-and-Analysis"></a></h3><p>Let's start our analysis by trying to answer question <strong>1</strong>; that is, how many markets has Sinclair operated in over time? Using our merged dataset, we need to look at each DMA and find all the times when Sinclair had at least one station operating. The code below, using <code>group_by()</code>, approximates this.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[77]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>sinclair_dma_df <span class="o"><-</span> sinclair_station_dma_df <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    group_by<span class="p">(</span>DMA<span class="p">,</span> DMA.Code<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span>
    summarize<span class="p">(</span>Year.Start <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">min</span><span class="p">(</span>Year.Start<span class="p">),</span> Year.End <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">max</span><span class="p">(</span>Year.End<span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[78]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_dma_df<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th scope="col">DMA</th><th scope="col">DMA.Code</th><th scope="col">Year.Start</th><th scope="col">Year.End</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr><td>Abilene-Sweetwater, TX     </td><td>662                        </td><td>2017                       </td><td>NA                         </td></tr>
<tr><td>Albany-Schenectady-Troy, NY</td><td>532                        </td><td>2012                       </td><td>NA                         </td></tr>
<tr><td>Albany, GA                 </td><td>525                        </td><td>2013                       </td><td>NA                         </td></tr>
<tr><td>Amarillo, TX               </td><td>634                        </td><td>2013                       </td><td>NA                         </td></tr>
<tr><td>Austin, TX                 </td><td>635                        </td><td>2012                       </td><td>NA                         </td></tr>
<tr><td>Bakersfield, CA            </td><td>800                        </td><td>2013                       </td><td>NA                         </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>dma_attributes_path <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="s">"Interactive_DMA_Map/tv_2017.csv"</span>
dma_attributes_df <span class="o"><-</span> read.csv<span class="p">(</span>dma_attributes_path<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">colnames</span><span class="p">(</span>dma_attributes_df<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"DMA.Code"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Rank"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"DMA"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"TV.Homes"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Percent.of.US"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>dma_attributes_df<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th scope="col">DMA.Code</th><th scope="col">Rank</th><th scope="col">DMA</th><th scope="col">TV.Homes</th><th scope="col">Percent.of.US</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr><td>662                    </td><td>165                    </td><td>Abilene-Sweetwater     </td><td>113,080                </td><td>0.099                  </td></tr>
<tr><td>525                    </td><td>152                    </td><td>Albany, GA             </td><td>142,800                </td><td>0.125                  </td></tr>
<tr><td>532                    </td><td> 59                    </td><td>Albany-Schenectady-Troy</td><td>529,120                </td><td>0.461                  </td></tr>
<tr><td>790                    </td><td> 48                    </td><td>Albuquerque-Santa Fe   </td><td>677,590                </td><td>0.591                  </td></tr>
<tr><td>644                    </td><td>179                    </td><td>Alexandria, LA         </td><td>85,560                 </td><td>0.075                  </td></tr>
<tr><td>583                    </td><td>208                    </td><td>Alpena                 </td><td>16,010                 </td><td>0.014                  </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>sinclair_dma_attr_df <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">merge</span><span class="p">(</span>dma_attributes_df<span class="p">[</span><span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"DMA.Code"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"TV.Homes"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Percent.of.US"</span><span class="p">)],</span> 
                              sinclair_dma_df<span class="p">[</span><span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"DMA.Code"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Year.Start"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Year.End"</span><span class="p">)],</span> 
                              by <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"DMA.Code"</span><span class="p">)</span>
sinclair_dma_attr_df<span class="o">$</span>TV.Homes <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">gsub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">","</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">""</span><span class="p">,</span> sinclair_dma_attr_df<span class="o">$</span>TV.Homes<span class="p">)</span>
sinclair_dma_attr_df<span class="o">$</span>TV.Homes <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">as.numeric</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.character</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_dma_attr_df<span class="o">$</span>TV.Homes<span class="p">))</span>
<span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_dma_attr_df<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th scope="col">DMA.Code</th><th scope="col">TV.Homes</th><th scope="col">Percent.of.US</th><th scope="col">Year.Start</th><th scope="col">Year.End</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr><td>500    </td><td> 383700</td><td>0.335  </td><td>  NA   </td><td>NA     </td></tr>
<tr><td>503    </td><td> 232910</td><td>0.203  </td><td>2014   </td><td>NA     </td></tr>
<tr><td>507    </td><td> 340050</td><td>0.296  </td><td>2014   </td><td>NA     </td></tr>
<tr><td>508    </td><td>1160220</td><td>1.012  </td><td>1991   </td><td>NA     </td></tr>
<tr><td>511    </td><td>2476680</td><td>2.159  </td><td>2014   </td><td>NA     </td></tr>
<tr><td>512    </td><td>1119480</td><td>0.976  </td><td>1971   </td><td>NA     </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">sapply</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_dma_attr_df<span class="p">,</span> <span class="kp">class</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<dl class="dl-horizontal">
<dt>DMA.Code</dt>
<dd>'integer'</dd>
<dt>TV.Homes</dt>
<dd>'numeric'</dd>
<dt>Percent.of.US</dt>
<dd>'numeric'</dd>
<dt>Year.Start</dt>
<dd>'numeric'</dd>
<dt>Year.End</dt>
<dd>'numeric'</dd>
</dl>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Get temporal limits of the data</span>
max_year <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">max</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_dma_attr_df<span class="o">$</span>Year.Start<span class="p">,</span> na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span>
min_year <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">min</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_dma_attr_df<span class="o">$</span>Year.Start<span class="p">,</span> na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Get rid of data that has missing year values</span>
no_na_year_df <span class="o"><-</span> sinclair_dma_attr_df <span class="o">%>%</span> filter<span class="p">(</span><span class="o">!</span><span class="kp">is.na</span><span class="p">(</span>Year.Start<span class="p">))</span>

<span class="c1"># Create aliases for the two year columns</span>
start_year <span class="o"><-</span> no_na_year_df<span class="o">$</span>Year.Start
end_year <span class="o"><-</span> no_na_year_df<span class="o">$</span>Year.End

<span class="c1"># Make a new data.frame and fill it using a for-loop</span>
<span class="c1"># This is a slow way to do it but our dataset is not huge </span>
sinclair_population_df <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">data.frame</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="kr">for</span><span class="p">(</span>year <span class="kr">in</span> min_year<span class="o">:</span>max_year<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="c1"># Generate the station count</span>
    <span class="c1"># Remember to take care of possible NA values in `end_year`</span>
    new_row <span class="o"><-</span> sinclair_dma_attr_df <span class="o">%>%</span>
        filter<span class="p">(</span> Year.Start <span class="o"><=</span> year <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span>Year.End <span class="o">>=</span> year <span class="o">|</span> <span class="kp">is.na</span><span class="p">(</span>Year.End<span class="p">))</span> <span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span>
        summarize<span class="p">(</span>TV.Homes.Tot <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">sum</span><span class="p">(</span>TV.Homes<span class="p">),</span> Percent.of.US.Tot <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kp">sum</span><span class="p">(</span>Percent.of.US<span class="p">))</span>
    new_row<span class="o">$</span>Year <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span>year<span class="p">)</span>
    sinclair_population_df <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">rbind</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_population_df<span class="p">,</span> new_row<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">

    geom_line<span class="p">(</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> Year<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> Percent.of.US.Tot<span class="p">),</span> color <span class="o">=</span> brewer.pal<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Set2"</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Sinclair Viewership"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
    xlab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Year"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> ylab<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Percent of USA Population"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
    theme<span class="p">(</span>plot.title <span class="o">=</span> element_text<span class="p">(</span>color<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#666666"</span><span class="p">,</span> face<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"bold"</span><span class="p">,</span> size<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">20</span><span class="p">))</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As we can see, this plot shows a very similar story compared to its earlier counterpart in <strong>Sinclair Station Exploration</strong>. Points of highest slope appear during large acquisitions in the mid-90s and 2011-2013. The last 5 years contain the all-time maximum:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[43]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">tail</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_population_df<span class="o">$</span>Percent.of.US.Tot<span class="p">,</span> n <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">5</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<ol class="list-inline">
<li>31.055</li>
<li>36.287</li>
<li>34.314</li>
<li>34.828</li>
<li>35.494</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">max</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_population_df<span class="o">$</span>Percent.of.US.Tot<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
36.287
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>So, currently, Sinclair Broadcast delivers local news to 35.494% of the US population. This number was highest in 2014 with a value of 36.287%.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">max</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_population_df<span class="o">$</span>TV.Homes.Tot<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
41619730
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Nielson estimates the total number of TV homes for the 2016-2017 period is 118.4 million. Using this we number we validate our previous estimate because 41,619,730 / 118,400,000 = 0.3515 = 35.15%. The numbers differ slightly because not every "TV Home" will have the same number of people in it.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>sinclair_final_df <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">merge</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_dma_df<span class="p">,</span> dma_geo_df<span class="p">,</span> by.x <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"DMA"</span><span class="p">,</span> by.y <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"dma1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
sinclair_final_df <span class="o"><-</span> sinclair_final_df <span class="o">%>%</span>
    select<span class="p">(</span>DMA<span class="p">,</span> id<span class="p">,</span> long<span class="p">,</span> lat<span class="p">,</span> <span class="kp">order</span><span class="p">,</span> hole<span class="p">,</span> piece<span class="p">,</span> group<span class="p">,</span> Year.Start<span class="p">,</span> Year.End<span class="p">)</span>
sinclair_final_df <span class="o"><-</span> sinclair_final_df<span class="p">[</span><span class="kp">order</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_final_df<span class="o">$</span>id<span class="p">,</span> sinclair_final_df<span class="o">$</span><span class="kp">order</span><span class="p">),]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">head</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_final_df<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th></th><th scope="col">DMA</th><th scope="col">id</th><th scope="col">long</th><th scope="col">lat</th><th scope="col">order</th><th scope="col">hole</th><th scope="col">piece</th><th scope="col">group</th><th scope="col">Year.Start</th><th scope="col">Year.End</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
<tr><th scope="row">3227</th><td>Portland-Auburn, ME</td><td>500                </td><td>-70.97725          </td><td>43.35754           </td><td>1                  </td><td>FALSE              </td><td>1                  </td><td>500.1              </td><td>NA                 </td><td>NA                 </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">3167</th><td>Portland-Auburn, ME</td><td>500                </td><td>-70.95991          </td><td>43.54138           </td><td>2                  </td><td>FALSE              </td><td>1                  </td><td>500.1              </td><td>NA                 </td><td>NA                 </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">3316</th><td>Portland-Auburn, ME</td><td>500                </td><td>-71.11016          </td><td>43.50660           </td><td>3                  </td><td>FALSE              </td><td>1                  </td><td>500.1              </td><td>NA                 </td><td>NA                 </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">3277</th><td>Portland-Auburn, ME</td><td>500                </td><td>-71.12750          </td><td>43.57367           </td><td>4                  </td><td>FALSE              </td><td>1                  </td><td>500.1              </td><td>NA                 </td><td>NA                 </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">3278</th><td>Portland-Auburn, ME</td><td>500                </td><td>-71.26042          </td><td>43.57119           </td><td>5                  </td><td>FALSE              </td><td>1                  </td><td>500.1              </td><td>NA                 </td><td>NA                 </td></tr>
<tr><th scope="row">3209</th><td>Portland-Auburn, ME</td><td>500                </td><td>-71.53203          </td><td>43.76496           </td><td>6                  </td><td>FALSE              </td><td>1                  </td><td>500.1              </td><td>NA                 </td><td>NA                 </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[34]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>plot_sinclair_dmas <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>year<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="c1"># Separate the spatial data into four datasets</span>
    plot_df <span class="o"><-</span> sinclair_final_df <span class="o">%>%</span>
        mutate<span class="p">(</span>Acquired <span class="o">=</span> case_when<span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="p">(</span>Year.Start <span class="o"><</span> year<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span>Year.End <span class="o">></span> year <span class="o">|</span> <span class="kp">is.na</span><span class="p">(</span>Year.End<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">~</span> <span class="s">"acquired\nprevious years"</span><span class="p">,</span>
            Year.Start <span class="o">==</span> year <span class="o">~</span> <span class="s">"acquired\nthis year"</span><span class="p">,</span>
            Year.End <span class="o">==</span> year <span class="o">~</span> <span class="s">"sold\nthis year"</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="kc">TRUE</span> <span class="o">~</span> <span class="s">"not held"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># We don't want to show the DMAs that were not held during the given year</span>
    held_mask <span class="o"><-</span> plot_df<span class="o">$</span>Acquired <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="s">"not held"</span>
    plot_df <span class="o"><-</span> plot_df<span class="p">[</span>held_mask<span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">]</span>
    factor_levels <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"acquired\nprevious years"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"acquired\nthis year"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"sold\nthis year"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    plot_df<span class="o">$</span>Acquired <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">factor</span><span class="p">(</span>plot_df<span class="o">$</span>Acquired<span class="p">,</span> levels <span class="o">=</span> factor_levels<span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Pick some nice colors</span>
    nice_colors <span class="o"><-</span> brewer.pal<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Set2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Make the plot</span>
    ggplot<span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span>
        coord_map<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"albers"</span><span class="p">,</span> lat0 <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">37.5</span><span class="p">,</span> lat1 <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">29.5</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
        geom_polygon<span class="p">(</span>data <span class="o">=</span> dma_geo_df<span class="p">,</span>
                     aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> long<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> lat<span class="p">,</span> group <span class="o">=</span> group<span class="p">),</span>
                     color <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"gray60"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
        geom_polygon<span class="p">(</span>data <span class="o">=</span> plot_df<span class="p">,</span>
                     aes<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> long<span class="p">,</span> y <span class="o">=</span> lat<span class="p">,</span> group <span class="o">=</span> group<span class="p">,</span> fill <span class="o">=</span> Acquired<span class="p">),</span>
                     color <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"gray60"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
        scale_fill_manual<span class="p">(</span>values <span class="o">=</span> nice_colors<span class="p">,</span> drop <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">FALSE</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>
        theme<span class="p">(</span>plot.title <span class="o">=</span> element_text<span class="p">(</span>hjust <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">0.1</span><span class="p">,</span> color<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"#666666"</span><span class="p">,</span> face<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"bold"</span><span class="p">,</span> size<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">20</span><span class="p">),</span> 
            axis.text <span class="o">=</span> element_blank<span class="p">(),</span> 
            axis.line <span class="o">=</span> element_blank<span class="p">(),</span> 
            axis.ticks <span class="o">=</span> element_blank<span class="p">(),</span>
            axis.title <span class="o">=</span> element_blank<span class="p">(),</span>
            panel.border <span class="o">=</span> element_blank<span class="p">(),</span>
            legend.position <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">0.93</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="m">0.5</span><span class="p">),</span>
            legend.key.size <span class="o">=</span> unit<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"cm"</span><span class="p">),</span>
            legend.text <span class="o">=</span> element_text<span class="p">(</span>size<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">12</span><span class="p">),</span>
            legend.title <span class="o">=</span> element_text<span class="p">(</span>size<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">12</span><span class="p">),</span>
            panel.grid <span class="o">=</span> element_blank<span class="p">(),</span>
            panel.background <span class="o">=</span> element_blank<span class="p">())</span> <span class="o">+</span>
        ggtitle<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">paste</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Sinclair DMAs in"</span><span class="p">,</span> year<span class="p">))</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[47]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>IMAGE_OUTPUT_PATH <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="s">"Images"</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[48]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>ggsave<span class="p">(</span>filename <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">'Sinclair_Viewership.png'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
    plot <span class="o">=</span> sinclair_population_plot<span class="p">,</span>
    path <span class="o">=</span> IMAGE_OUTPUT_PATH<span class="p">,</span>
    width <span class="o">=</span> unit<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"cm"</span><span class="p">),</span>
    height <span class="o">=</span> unit<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"cm"</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In[]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>max_year <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">max</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_final_df<span class="o">$</span>Year.Start<span class="p">,</span> na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span>
min_year <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">min</span><span class="p">(</span>sinclair_final_df<span class="o">$</span>Year.Start<span class="p">,</span> na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="kr">for</span><span class="p">(</span>year <span class="kr">in</span> min_year<span class="o">:</span>max_year<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    image <span class="o"><-</span> plot_sinclair_dmas<span class="p">(</span>year<span class="p">)</span>
    image.name <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">paste</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Sinclair_DMAs"</span><span class="p">,</span> year<span class="p">,</span> sep <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"_"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    image.name <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">paste</span><span class="p">(</span>image.name<span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">".png"</span><span class="p">,</span> sep <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    ggsave<span class="p">(</span>filename <span class="o">=</span> image.name<span class="p">,</span> 
        plot <span class="o">=</span> image<span class="p">,</span>
        path <span class="o">=</span> IMAGE_OUTPUT_PATH<span class="p">,</span>
        width <span class="o">=</span> unit<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">14</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"cm"</span><span class="p">),</span>
        height <span class="o">=</span> unit<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"cm"</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">if (!document.getElementById('mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#')) {
    var mathjaxscript = document.createElement('script');
    mathjaxscript.id = 'mathjaxscript_pelican_#%@#$@#';
    mathjaxscript.type = 'text/javascript';
    mathjaxscript.src = '//cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML';
    mathjaxscript[(window.opera ? "innerHTML" : "text")] =
        "MathJax.Hub.Config({" +
        "    config: ['MMLorHTML.js']," +
        "    TeX: { extensions: ['AMSmath.js','AMSsymbols.js','noErrors.js','noUndefined.js'], equationNumbers: { autoNumber: 'AMS' } }," +
        "    jax: ['input/TeX','input/MathML','output/HTML-CSS']," +
        "    extensions: ['tex2jax.js','mml2jax.js','MathMenu.js','MathZoom.js']," +
        "    displayAlign: 'center'," +
        "    displayIndent: '0em'," +
        "    showMathMenu: true," +
        "    tex2jax: { " +
        "        inlineMath: [ ['$','$'] ], " +
        "        displayMath: [ ['$$','$$'] ]," +
        "        processEscapes: true," +
        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +
        "    'HTML-CSS': { " +
        "        styles: { '.MathJax_Display, .MathJax .mo, .MathJax .mi, .MathJax .mn': {color: 'black ! important'} }" +
        "    } " +
        "}); ";
    (document.body || document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0]).appendChild(mathjaxscript);
}
</script>

entry.title: I'm Starting a Blog!
entry.summary: An introduction to the mimsy.io blog
entry.content:
I'm Starting a Blog!

Welcome to mimsy.io! Just another blog about data science, learning, and general tomfoolery involving cool visualizations.

Like many blogs, this site doesn't have much structure. However, I do file the different post under different categories. If you need some guidance, theses are the different types of posts I'll be writing:

  • Announcements: Post like this one that provide information about the site itself.
  • Stories: Posts that read more like news articles. Here, I take a story I've heard somewhere else and try to explore it further using data.
  • Notebooks: Blog post versions of JUPYTER notebooks. I usually post these a supplementary material to other posts (like Stories). These involve code (usually R or Python) and detail steps I took to create graphs, maps, and visualizations.
  • Tutorials: Post where I explore and try to explain various topics in data science, statistics, and machine learning.

As of right now, there's not much content on the site, but this will hopefully change soon!
